long.am,ar,bg,bn,ca,cs,da,de,el,en,en_AU,en_G:
Simple analog clock 4h, the top row shows the 24 hours of the day. The red line represents the whole hours, the yellow lines 6, 12 and 18. The background of this element changes slowly to random colours.
The main time hand is the green hand, moving to the right. 
Below it, the white horizontal bar shows sunrise and sunset.
Below it, the green horizontal bar shows moonrise and moonset.
Below it, the indicator moving from right to left shows the quarter hour relative to the green indicator, like a magnifying glass for the top segment.
At the bottom is a second hand. The coincidence of the lines indicates the exact second. This was inspired by the division of the vernier. The lower division is fixed at 60 divisions, the upper one moves to the right, both also randomly changing colour.
